address: 1380 Sherbrooke St W, Montréal, QC H3G 1J5
description: The Musée des Beaux-Arts de Montréal is one of Canada's oldest and most beloved art museums. With a collection of over 43000 works of art, the museum offers a unique perspective on the history of art from ancient to contemporary times. The museum's impressive collection includes works by artists such as Paul Cézanne, Vincent van Gogh, and Pablo Picasso, as well as a significant collection of Canadian and Indigenous art. Visitors can explore the museum's permanent and temporary exhibitions, attend lectures and events, and participate in educational programs for children and adults.
